intro: Urgineopsis salteri, commonly known as Salter's urge, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom during the summer months. The plant has smooth, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Urgineopsis salteri is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
